abstract.para: This book covers the use of the Mandrill plugin for Joomla. It does not cover any other extension available on compojoom.com .

section.title: Introducing Mandrillapp.com
section.para: In April 2012 Mailchimp (http://mailchimp.com) introduced a new transactional email service called Mandrill (http://mandrillapp.com). Mandrill is using the same optimized delivery engine that MailChimp uses for the delivery of bulk newsletters – slightly modified for one-to-one email. The core features of Mandrill are:

listitem.para: Uses MailChimp's awesome email delivery engine
Automatically adds Google Analytics tracking data to the URLs in the mail
Has pretty, visual reports of the email results
Allows you to tag the emails and see your stats filtered by tag

section.title: Introducing Mandrill Plugin for Joomla
section.para: Since you normally need to be a programmy nerd to use the service MailChimp asked us to create an integration for Mandrill's API into Joomla. And there you have it! You'll just need to provide your Mandrill API key and enable the plugin - after that all e-mails* send by Joomla are going to be sent trough the Mandrill API.

* All extensions that use the standard Joomla API for sending mails will continue to function as normal and the mails will be send trough Joomla. If you are using extensions that have their own Mail classes, then those extensions will continue to function as normal, but they won't use the Mandrill API

chapter.title: Installation and Updates
chapter.para: Installing the Mandrill plugin for Joomla is easy it is not in any way different than installing any other Joomla!™ extension/module/plugin on your site. You can read the complete instructions for installing Joomla!™ extensions on the official joomla help page .Throughout this chapter we assume that you are familiar with these instructions and we will not duplicate them.

section.title: Getting the installation packages
section.para: You can download the latest installation packages by visiting our site at https://compojoom.com. (you need to be login) In the download menu you will see the Mandrill menu item. Click on it. The latest releases are listed with the newest release always on top. Click on the release number and then download the ZIP package.

section.title: Compatibility
section.para: The Mandrill Plugin for Joomla is compatible with Joomla 2.5

section.title: Updating to the latest version
section.para: The plugin uses the standard update routine in Joomla. All you need to do is to go Extensions -> Extension Manager -> Update in your Joomla backend. Then click on "Find Updates" if a new version of the plugin is available you will be able to update by selecting it and clicking on the "Update" button

chapter.title: Using the Mandrill Plugin for Joomla
chapter.para: To manage the plugin go to your Extension - Plugin manager and find the "System - Mandrill" plugin. Select the plugin and click on the "Edit" option on the top right of your screen. After that you should presented with a screen similar to this one:

In the API key field provide your Mandrill API key (on the day of writing of that documentation the API key could be found by clicking on the settings button (top right) the mandrillapp.com page (you need to be logged in to see it))

The use https option defines if the plugin should communicate with Mandrill server through an SSL connection or not. We recommend to set this option to yes if your hosting has the necessary php ssl libraries for this.

Once you've provided a valid API key, you can enable the plugin. That's it! now your Joomla site should be sending e-mails using the Mandrill API. You can test this by going to "users -> mass mail" then try to send a mail to your Super users. The mail that your super users are going to receive should be comming from the Mandrill servers.

note.para: When you send a mass mail the user that sends the mail won't receive a mail. This is the way the "Mass Mail" extension works in Joomla and has nothing to do with the Mandrill plugin

section.title: Sending limits
section.para: Depending on your Mandrill account there are different sending limits that apply for you. If you are a free user then this limit is currently 12 000 emails per month. For more information on sending limits please refer to Mandrill's help pages.

The current implementation of the plugin checks how many emals you have send for the day and how big your sending limit is. If you have reached your sending e-mail then the plugin will fall back to the standard JMailer class and will send the mails according to the settings that you have specified in your Global Configuration (Joomla's global configuration. Accessible through Site -> Global Configuration -> Server -> Mail Settings)

section.title: CC emails
section.para: If a Joomla extension tries to send and ads the CC option to the mail, then the plugin will fallback to the standard JMailer class and won't use the Mandrill API.

section.title: What happens with rejected mails?
section.para: In some situations the Mandrill API won't send the mail and will return a rejected status for it. In this case the plugin will try to send the mail to the recipient again, but this time using the standard JMailer class.

section.title: Logging
section.para: The plugin uses the standard Joomla JLog class to log errors and warnings. The logs are saved in the folder configured in your Joomla's Global Configuration. The logs are splitted by Month. You can expect them to identify situations in which the plugin was not able to send the email using Mandrill's API and has fallen back to the standard JMailer class.

section.title: Tags
section.para: For each Mail we try to add the following tags:

listitem.para: option - identifies the Joomla component sending the email
view - identifies the view of the component sending the mail
task - identifies the task that is executed by the component sending the mail

section.para: Each of this tags is added only if we are able to identify it.

chapter.title: Support
chapter.para: The Mandrill Plugin for Joomla is released free of charge. Community support is available in our Forum in the Mandrill section.
